main event: A pilot of Eastern Airlines Flight 883 reported observing a bright object traveling in a south-southwesterly direction at a high rate of speed in the Atlantic Ocean on 30 November 1953 at 2020-2125Z.
interesting points: The object had no visible nav lights but showed illuminated windows.
Flames appeared from the rear of the object, and the tail of the aircraft was observed violently with flames.
The object leveled off at 1000 feet and disappeared to the side after 70 seconds at a speed estimated to be 215 knots.
The sighting duration was 59 minutes North of Scolt Head Royal Air Force Base.
sighted object: bright object traveling at high speed with illuminated windows and flames from the rear
